title: SS.PT.409
prompt: How does the historical context of this speech shape Lincoln's point of view?
description: The passage is an excerpt from President Abraham Lincoln's Second Inaugural Address, given in March of 1865, just weeks before the American Civil War officially ended.
feedback: Lincoln's tone and point of view is obvious in his opening sentence: "With malice toward none; with charity for all. . ." For Lincoln, the sadness and loss of the war is still fresh. He is not "triumphant in victory" nor does he stress his own "leadership skills." Finally, he does not want "punishment for the southern states." Instead, Lincoln urges charity toward all in an effort to "bind up the nation's wounds."
